function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Discrepancies between laboratories due to factors such as qPCR platforms, PCR inhibitors, nucleic acid extraction efficiency, and low levels of targets","Impact":"Inconsistent test results and unreliable data for comparing viral content among different laboratories","Mitigation":"Standardization of protocols for concentration method, PCR assay, and process controls","Technologies":"Standardized qPCR platforms and improved nucleic acid extraction techniques","People":"Laboratory technicians, researchers, public health officials","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions"},{"Description":"Large uncertainty in viral load in feces making it difficult to determine a typical value for WBE and comparison with clinical data","Impact":"Inaccurate data on viral content in feces for wastewater-based epidemiology (WBE) and comparison with clinical data","Mitigation":"Development of standardized methods for determining viral load in feces and comparison with clinical data","Technologies":"Improved nucleic acid extraction methods, standardized qPCR platforms for fecal samples","People":"Public health officials, wastewater treatment plant operators, researchers","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions"},{"Description":"Lack of standardization in laboratory protocols for detecting SARS-CoV-2 and determining viral content","Impact":"Unreliable and incomparable data from different laboratories around the globe","Mitigation":"Global standardization of laboratory protocols for SARS-CoV-2 detection and viral content determination","Technologies":"Universal qPCR platforms, standardized nucleic acid extraction methods","People":"Laboratory technicians, researchers, public health officials","Owner":"Global health organizations, research institutions"}]}
